German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Proto-Germanic *hawjƒÖ. Cognate with Old Norse hey (Danish h√∏) and Gothic êå∑êå∞êçÖêåπ (hawi).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /h…î…™ÃØ/, [h…î…™ÃØ]

Noun

[edit]

Heu n (strong, genitive Heues or Heus, no plural)

  1. hay
    das Heu trocknen ‚Äï to make hay
    eine Stecknadel im Heuhaufen suchen ‚Äï to look for a needle in a haystack
  2. (colloquial) plentiful money
  3. (slang) marijuana

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Heu [sg-only, neuter, strong]

indef. def. noun

genitive eines des Heues, Heus
dative einem dem Heu, Heue1
accusative ein das Heu

1Now rare, see notes.
